metadata.title: CVE-2023-52905 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:octeontx2-pf: Fix resource leakage in VF driver unbindresources allocated like mcam entries to support the Ntuple featureand hash tables for the tc feature are not getting freed in driverunbind. This patch fixes the issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
